title: Google Pixel 10a pre-orders in India begin 18 February via Flipkart: What to expect
snippet: Google’s Pixel 10a will be available for pre-order in India from 18 February via Flipkart and the Google Store. The mid-range phone is expected to feature a 120Hz AMOLED display, Tensor G4 chip, dual rear cameras and multiple colour options, with full details set to be announced soon.

title: Apple opens Swift Student Challenge 2026 applications for young developers: Who can apply and the last date
snippet: Apple has opened applications for the Swift Student Challenge 2026, inviting students worldwide to build innovative apps using Swift. Winners can earn recognition and a chance to visit Apple Park in Cupertino.

title: Perplexity unveils Model Council to compare answers across AI models: How it works
snippet: Perplexity has launched Model Council, a new AI feature that runs queries across three models at once, compares their responses and highlights key insights, helping users verify information, reduce inconsistencies and make better-informed decisions faster.

title: Samsung Galaxy F70e 5G launched in India with 6,000mAh battery: Price, specs and more
snippet: Samsung unveils the Galaxy F70e 5G in India, featuring a 6,000mAh battery and a 120Hz display. Sales begin on February 17. Here are all specifications.

title: ChatGPT caricature trend: Check out step-by-step guide to recreate viral Instagram trend
snippet: A new trend involves using ChatGPT to create personalized caricatures based on users' chat history. The AI generates humorous images by capturing individual traits and hobbies. Check out the step-by-step guide below

title: Gujarat partners SpaceX’s Starlink to boost digital connectivity statewide: CM Bhupendra Patel
snippet: Gujarat has signed a Letter of Intent with Starlink to bring satellite-based high-speed internet to remote, border and tribal areas. The plan aims to improve digital access for schools, health centres, e-governance services and disaster management across underserved regions.

title: EU warns Meta WhatsApp policy could cause serious harm to rival AI chatbots: All you need to know
snippet: EU regulators have charged Meta with breaching antitrust rules after limiting WhatsApp to its own AI assistant. On Monday, the European Commission warns the move could sideline rivals, distort competition and may trigger interim measures to prevent lasting market harm.

title: What is AI.com? Meet the new AI agent platform that 'crashed' the Super Bowl
snippet: AI.com launched on 8 Feburary with a 30 second Super Bowl ad. The company gained massive traffic after the ad and crashed briefly. It is owned by Crypto.com CEO Kris Marszalek and was acquired by the enterprenuer for $70 million

title: AI.com website crashes during Super Bowl, netizens quip — ‘how to burn $10M’
snippet: AI.com's website crashed after a 30-second Super Bowl 60 ad drove massive traffic during the fourth quarter, leaving users frustrated with error messages.&nbsp;

title: Taiwan says 40% shift of chip capacity to US is impossible
snippet: TAIWAN-USA/TECH:Taiwan says 40% shift of chip capacity to US is 'impossible'

title: Tech Wrap Feb 9: Galaxy F70e 5G launched, Gemini in Chrome, Apple CarPlay
snippet: Samsung Galaxy F70e 5G launched in India. Gemini is now in Chromebook Plus. Apple CarPlay may support AI voice apps. Sony may launch WF-1000XM6. Qualcomm 2nm tape-out.

title: Xiaomi 17 global rollout may see smaller battery than China variant: Report
snippet: Xiaomi 17 may launch globally with a smaller battery than the China model, while retaining flagship specifications, fast charging speeds, and Leica-backed cameras

title: Redmi Note 15 Pro Plus review: A familiar formula, refined where it matters
snippet: The Redmi Note 15 Pro Plus sits at the top of Xiaomi's Note 15 lineup, offering a new 200MP camera, a large AMOLED display, and a bigger battery. Here's how it performs in everyday use

title: Qualcomm's 2nm tape-out adds momentum to India's semiconductor mission
snippet: While Qualcomm's 2nm semiconductor fabrication will happen overseas, the design work highlights India's expanding role in advanced chip development under ISM 2.0

title: Google expands Gemini in Chrome to Chromebook Plus devices: Details here
snippet: Google brings Gemini in Chrome to Chromebook Plus devices, adding AI tools to ChromeOS after earlier desktop-only availability

title: Amazon deepens ties with STMicro to secure semiconductors for data centres
snippet: Under the agreement, AWS received warrants to acquire as many as 24.8 million ordinary STMicro shares

title: Samsung Galaxy F70e 5G with MediaTek Dimensity 6300 launched: Check specs
snippet: Samsung has launched the Galaxy F70e 5G in India, marking the first model in the newly introduced Galaxy F70 lineup and expanding the company's F series portfolio in the country

title: Telegram's Android app gets Apple-style 'Liquid Glass' design: What's new
snippet: Telegram is rolling out a Liquid Glass-inspired redesign for its Android app, adding a new bottom navigation bar, transparent UI elements and refreshed menus with version 12.4.0

title: Apple may launch iPhone 17e, more MacBook Pro models in Feb: What to expect
snippet: Apple is expected to introduce the iPhone 17e and complete its MacBook Pro lineup with M5 Pro and M5 Max models, with launches likely in the coming weeks

title: Apple could bring third-party AI voice apps to CarPlay beyond Siri: Report
snippet: Reportedly, Apple may soon allow voice-based AI apps like ChatGPT to work inside CarPlay, letting drivers use third-party AI assistants instead of relying only on Siri

title: The stock shock, powered by AI
snippet: Global stocks slid last week as a sharp sell-off in software and tech erased billions in market value amid fears that rapid AI advances could put traditional software companies out of business, writes Shristi Achar.

title: Domestic MFs double their holdings in new-age startups over a year
snippet: These institutions accumulated significant stakes in consumer internet firms Eternal, Swiggy, Nykaa and PB Fintech this past year, despite mixed share performance. They also bought into companies such as Lenskart, Groww, Meesho and PhysicsWallah that entered the public market in 2025.

title: An AIdentity crisis
snippet: AI is making it really easy to clone and tweak anyone’s likeness. ET explains how this is turning identity into a valued intellectual property and what can be done to safeguard it.
